page.title: 04A Trip to the Fire Station
page.content: The Officer in charge is Sub-Officer Ford. He has 2 leading firemen and 8 men on the station, a crew of 11 men altogether and they are all part timers. Some men are allowed to go off work in emergencies. The first records of a fire attended is 1878. The fire station is over 100 yearsold. They originally relied on horses to pull the fire engine, now they are as modren as any other fire service. There is going to be a new fire station in Saxmundham. The siren on the pole is controlled by the police and was used in the second world war. The fire station has an average of 160 calls a year. The furtherest they have gone is Thetford which is 106 miles there and back.The whole fire service is controlled by the Ipswich fire station.The tank in todays fire engine holds 450 galons of water.
